{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the relevant documents, the treatment options for stage I cancer of the larynx include radiation therapy or transoral laser microsurgery. Both modalities have equivalent oncologic and functional outcomes. However, there is no direct comparison between the two for robust analysis. The goal for any larynx-sparing technique, either radiation or surgery, should be the intent to cure with single modality treatment and minimal short- and long-term toxicity. Therefore, the treatment of choice for stage I cancer larynx is either radiation therapy or transoral laser microsurgery.", "answer_choice": "C. Radiotherapy"}
